Name: Armored Frostboar
Notes_2:
This fancy silver swine is an achievement reward for battling while mounted on garrison stables training mounts. To be eligible, you must defeat the following six NPCs while mounted on each of your six training mounts, while carrying a Black Claw of Sethe:
Gorian Beast-Lasher
Ironbore
Karak the Great Hunter
Maimclaw
Moth of Wrath
Thundercall
The Black Claw of Sethe will only appear in level 2 stables and above. It may be looted at any time and is safe to discard when not required.
See also the Armoured Frostwolf.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Source:
Achievement: Advanced Husbandry
Achievement: Advanced Husbandry

Name: Armored Frostwolf
Notes_2:

Gorian Beast-Lasher
Ironbore
Karak the Great Hunter
Maimclaw
Moth of Wrath
Thundercall
The Garn-Tooth Necklace will only appear in level 2 stables and above. It may be looted at any time and is safe to discard when not required.
See also the Armoured Frostboar.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Source:
Achievement: The Stable Master
Achievement: The Stable Master

Name: Armored Irontusk
Notes_2:
To unlock the vendor for this mount you must construct a level 2 trading post at your garrison. This will allow you to gain reputation with the Sha'tari Defense and you must become Exalted to purchase the mount.
You will also automatically learn this mount if you purchase the Horde equivalent, the Ironside Warwolf, or vice versa.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Alliance Only
Source:
Maaria in Trading Post - Lunarfall (Alliance Garrison). Requires Exalted with Sha'tari Defense.
Cost: 5000 + 5000 (reputation discounts apply for some factions)

Name: Armored Razorback
Notes_2: One of three mounts that drop from elites found in Tanaan Jungle. The mount isn't directly looted from the NPC. Instead, there is a low (~15%) chance of each elite dropping a Rattling Iron Cage. The cage is guaranteed to contain one of the three mounts, though it's possible to receive the same mount twice. Each elite yields personal loot once per day.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Source:
Vengeance in Tanaan Jungle.
Deathtalon in Tanaan Jungle.
Terrorfist in Tanaan Jungle.
Doomroller in Tanaan Jungle.

Source: Achievement: Guild Glory of the Draenor Raider

Reputation with Vol'jin's Spear is earned by engaging in various activities in the Ashran PvP zone, including completing mini-events and handing in quests.

Note that this mount was retired while Ashran was closed. It originally cost 5000 Apexis Crystals instead of 100 Marks of Honor, but this changed when Ashran reopened.

Cost: 5000 + 100 (reputation discounts apply for some factions)

Notes_2: This mount is sold by Z'tenga the Walker, who can be found at the entrance to Fang'rila in the southern Tanaan Jungle. To purchase it you need to collect 5000 Blackfang Claws, by killing the Saberon in the area, and also reach Exalted with his new faction.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Source:

Name: Champion's Treadblade
Notes_2: This unique snowmobile-style mount is the in-game version of the losing bike from Azeroth Choppers. As such it was never available for free like the Horde equivalent, but is purchasable by someone with a lot of spare gold!

This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Alliance Only
Source:

Cost: 100 000

Name: Chauffeured Mechano-Hog
Notes_2:
This mount and its Alliance equivalent - the Chauffeured Mekgineer's Chopper - are earned by completing an achievement to collect 35 different heirloom gear items. These mounts are unique in two ways: they are usable by level 1 characters, and they come with chauffeurs. The Horde chauffeur is Koak Hoburn. Your character sits in the sidecar.
The mount arrives in the mail once you complete the achievement. As the achievement is account-wide you will automatically receive the equivalent mount for your characters on the opposing faction.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 1
Horde Only
Source: Achievement: Heirloom Hoarder

Name: Chauffeured Mekgineer's Chopper
Notes_2:
This mount and its Horde equivalent - the Chauffeured Mechano-Hog - are earned by completing an achievement to collect 35 different heirloom gear items. These mounts are unique in two ways: they are usable by level 1 characters, and they come with chauffeurs. The Alliance chauffeur is Franklin Martin. Your character sits in the sidecar.
The mount arrives in the mail once you complete the achievement. As the achievement is account-wide you will automatically receive the equivalent mount for your characters on the opposing faction.

Name: Creeping Carpet
Notes_2:
Unlike other carpets, and true to its name, it's listed as a ground mount rather than a flying mount.

Note that it requires a Draenor Tailoring skill of at least 1 to craft and learn (it's soulbound), but it can be ridden by any character on your account that has a basic Tailoring skill of at least 1.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 70
Artisan (300) Riding
Tailoring (1)
Source: Profession : Tailoring

Name: Crimson Water Strider
Notes_2:
This vivid red version of the Azure Water Strider mount may be obtained in Warlords of Draenor. It is available from Nat Pagle, in your garrison, but he'll only sell it to you if you're one of his Best Friends. The entire process is rather long and complicated!
To access Nat Pagle you must build a Fishing Shack in your Garrison and advance it to level 3.
To advance your friendship with Nat, you can perform quests for him, from both Warlords of Draenor and Mists of Pandaria. See this Wowhead page for more information.
To obtain 100 of Nat's Lucky Coins you have to fish up "lunkers", which are rare variants on regular Draenor zone fish, and turn them in to Nat. The coins are also found as uncommon loot from Cavedweller murlocs in your Garrison's fishing pond in Draenor. The murlocs can be summoned with Lunarfall Carp (Alliance) or Frostdeep Minnows (Horde), which can occasionally be caught from the same pond once you advance your Fishing Shack to level 3. This latter method is probably slower, but there's also a rare chance the murlocs will drop a Sea Turtle or Riding Turtle mount.


Before the addition of Mount Equipment this mount was one of only two that were adept at water-walking. This innate ability was removed from water striders in Patch 8.2.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 90
Journeyman (150) Riding
Source:
Nat Pagle in Frostwall and Lunarfall. Requires Best Friends with Nat Pagle.
Cost: 100 (reputation discounts apply for some factions)

Name: Vicious War Kodo
Notes_2:
To purchase this armoured kodo you must be victorious in a great many rated arenas or battlegrounds in a single PvP season. The procedure is as follows:
You must reach the PvP rank of Combatant. You can obtain this ranking by reaching a rating of 1400 by competing in 2v2, 3v3, or 10v10 arenas and battlegrounds.
Once you've reached Combatant ranking you must win further matches in the same season, until your progress bar reaches 100% (2400 points). You'll then receive the current season's mount (not this one).
For each subsequent time you fill your progress bar during the season you'll receive a Vicious Saddle, which you may use to purchase older Vicious mounts, including this one.
It appears the 1400 rating is specific to the match type you earned it in. For example, if you only earned the rating in 10v10 then you cannot progress towards the mount in 2v2 (until you also earn a 1400 rating in the latter).
The number of matches required to fill your progress bar depends on the type of match. According to comments on Wowhead, by Rainewater, you require 40 wins from 10v10 (60 points / win), 80 wins from 3v3 (30 points / win), or 240 wins from 2v2 (10 points / win).
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Horde Only
Source:
Deathguard Netharian in Orgrimmar.
Cost: 1

Requirements:

Name: Voidtalon of the Dark Star
Notes_2: This mount is obtained by entering a randomly-spawning smoky portal. The portal has multiple known spawn points (at least sixteen, perhaps more) across all zones, with the possible exception of Ashran. The portal leads to a mini-instance called The Edge of Reality, containing a dead NPC - The Last Voidtalon - and a single, lootable egg which teaches the mount. If there are complications and you can't enter the instance properly you should receive the mount in the mail.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 100
Master (375) Riding

Name: Warsong Direfang
Notes_2: One of three mounts that drop from elites found in Tanaan Jungle. The mount isn't directly looted from the NPC. Instead, there is a low (~15%) chance of each elite dropping a Rattling Iron Cage. The cage is guaranteed to contain one of the three mounts, though it's possible to receive the same mount twice. Each elite yields personal loot once per day.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Source:
Vengeance in Tanaan Jungle.
Deathtalon in Tanaan Jungle.
Terrorfist in Tanaan Jungle.
Doomroller in Tanaan Jungle.

Name: Wild Goretusk
Notes_2: This mount is sold by Z'tenga the Walker, who can be found at the entrance to Fang'rila in the southern Tanaan Jungle. To purchase it you need to collect 1000 Blackfang Claws, by killing the Saberon in the area, and also reach Honored with his new faction.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Source:
Z'tenga the Walker in Tanaan Jungle. Requires Honored with The Saberstalkers.
Cost: 1000 (reputation discounts apply for some factions)

Name: Witherhide Cliffstomper
Notes_2: Sold by new garrison traders in Patch 6.2.
